sourceDesc.p: TEI-page files converted by Python to TEI-entry file

div.p: SAIDAPET, a town of British India, administrative head-quarters of Chingleput district, Madras, on the' South Indian railway, 5 m. S.W. of Madras city, from which it is separated by a line of tanks. Pop. (1901) 14,254. The government teachersâ€™ college has a hostel or boarding-house for Brahmans, opened in 1897. The agricultural college, originally (1865) a model farm, has been transferred to Coimbatore.
